name: Amulet of Kroog
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.

name: Argivian Blacksmith
oracle_text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.
flavor_text: Through years of study and training, the Blacksmiths of Argive became adept at reassembling the mangled remains of the strange, mechanical creatures abounding in their native land.

name: Argothian Pixies
oracle_text:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.
flavor_text: After the rape of Argoth Forest during the rule of the artificers, the Pixies of Argoth bent their magic to more practical ends.

name: Argothian Treefolk
oracle_text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Treefolk by artifact sources.
flavor_text: Haunting cries we hear in our dreams As the forest dies, a death from machines.

name: Artifact Blast
oracle_text: Counter target artifact spell.
flavor_text: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

name: Artifact Possession
oracle_text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever enchanted artifact becomes tapped or a player activates an ability of enchanted artifact without {T} in its activation cost, Artifact Possession deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.
flavor_text: Any black mage could coax a Thraxodemon to inhabit a magical device.

name: Artifact Ward
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by artifact sources.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of abilities from artifact sources.

name: Battering Ram
oracle_text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
flavor_text: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

name: Clay Statue
oracle_text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
flavor_text: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

name: Crumble
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its mana value.
flavor_text: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

name: Drafna's Restoration
oracle_text: Put any number of target artifact cards from target player's graveyard on top of their library in any order.
flavor_text: Drafna, founder of the College of Lat-Nam, could create a working model from even the smallest remnants of a newly unearthed artifact.

name: Dragon Engine
oracle_text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

name: Grapeshot Catapult
oracle_text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor_text: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

name: Orcish Mechanics
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Mechanics deals 2 damage to any target.

name: Ornithopter
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

name: Phyrexian Gremlins
oracle_text:
You may choose not to untap Phyrexian Gremlins during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target artifact. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Phyrexian Gremlins remains tapped.

name: Priest of Yawgmoth
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed artifact's mana value.

name: Reconstruction
oracle_text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

name: Reverse Polarity
oracle_text: You gain X life, where X is twice the damage dealt to you so far this turn by artifacts.

name: Sage of Lat-Nam
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

name: Staff of Zegon
oracle_text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

name: Tablet of Epityr
oracle_text: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.

name: Urza's Chalice
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

name: Urza's Mine
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

name: Urza's Power Plant
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Artifact construction required immense resources.

name: Urza's Tower
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} instead.
flavor_text: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

name: Yotian Soldier
oracle_text: Vigilance
flavor_text: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.
